name: John W. TRUDE, v. Brian MARTIN, an individual, Rod Shellhouse, an individual, Nancy Brown, an individual, Donati's Inc., a corporation and Equitable Financial Management, Inc., Petition of EQUITABLE FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT, INC.

parties: John W. TRUDE, v. Brian MARTIN, an individual, Rod Shellhouse, an individual, Nancy Brown, an individual, Donati’s Inc., a corporation and Equitable Financial Management, Inc., Petition of EQUITABLE FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT, INC.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 25th day of January, 1996, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED limited to the question of whether delay damages should be calculated on a joint and several liability basis of the entire molded verdict or whether delay damages should be assessed according to petitioner’s proportionate share of liability.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

casebody.head_matter:
672 A.2d 279
John W. TRUDE, v. Brian MARTIN, an individual, Rod Shellhouse, an individual, Nancy Brown, an individual, Donati’s Inc., a corporation and Equitable Financial Management, Inc., Petition of EQUITABLE FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT, INC.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Jan. 25, 1996.
